intro: Artanthe salviifolia, commonly known as the mountain beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped, gray-green leaves and tall, spindly stems that bear clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant is part of the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its often hairy stems and showy flowers. Artanthe salviifolia thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for native plant gardens.
